message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, but only if you agree to buy it now. If you don't buy it now, the price will go back to $1000000.
I accept your offer and will buy the product at $900000.

You just bought a high-quality product for $900000, which is 10% off the original price. I'm glad you're happy with the deal! For the next product, I'd like to offer you a similar deal. I'll give you another 10% off the original price of $1000000, but only if you buy it now. If you don't, the price will go back to $1000000. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I will stick to my original decision to pay the full price of $1000000 for this product.

You've decided to stick with the original price. I'll respect that. However, I'd like to point out that you just bought two high-quality products at $1000000 each, which is a total of $2000000. If you buy the next product at the full price, you'll be spending a total of $3000000. I'm willing to offer you a 'package deal' - if you buy the next three products, I'll give you a 5% discount on each one, bringing the price down to $950000 per product. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, but I prefer to make decisions on a product-by-product basis. I will consider purchasing the next product at the full price.

You've decided to wait and see. I'll give you a more straightforward offer this time. I've noticed that you're willing to pay $1000000 for a high-quality product, and you've already done so twice. I'm willing to offer you a 'guarantee': if you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it's low-quality. Would you like to take advantage of this guarantee and buy the product at $1000000?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I will still purchase the product at the full price of $1000000. This ensures I get the best possible outcome regardless of the product's quality.

You're a savvy buyer! You're right, buying at the full price ensures you get the best possible outcome. I'll make a note of that. Since you're willing to pay $1000000 for a high-quality product, I'll try to make a more informed offer. I'll give you a 'price range' for this product. If it's high-quality, I'll sell it to you for $1000000. If it's low-quality, I'll sell it to you for $500000. You can choose to buy it at either price. What would you like to do?
I understand your offer, but I will continue to purchase the product at the full price of $1000000, as I value the certainty of getting a high-quality product.

You're sticking to your strategy. I'll respect that. Since you're consistently willing to pay $1000000 for high-quality products, I'll try to make a more nuanced offer. I'll give you a'signal' about the product's quality. If I think it's high-quality, I'll tell you that I've sold 3 high-quality products so far. If I think it's low-quality, I won't mention the number. Based on this signal, can you decide whether to buy the product at $1000000?
Based on your signal, I will buy the product at the full price of $1000000, trusting that the majority of products have been high-quality based on your previous sales.

You've bought 4 high-quality products so far, and now you've bought this one. I'll give you another signal. This time, I'll tell you that I've sold a total of 5 products, and 4 of them were high-quality. However, I'll also mention that the last product you bought was not high-quality. I'm offering you a chance to 'update your expectations' about the product's quality. Based on this new information, do you want to buy the product at $1000000?

Considering the updated information, I will buy the product at the full price of $1000000, taking into account the recent sale of a low-quality product but also the majority of high-quality products sold previously.

You've bought 5 high-quality products and 2 low-quality products so far. I'll give you another signal. This time, I'll tell you that the probability of a product being high-quality is 80%, as it was at the beginning. However, I'll also mention that you've already bought 2 low-quality products, which is a higher proportion than expected. I'm offering you a 'hedging option': if you buy this product, I'll give you a 20% discount if it's high-quality, and a 50% discount if it's low-quality. What do you think?
Given the hedging option, I will buy the product at $800000 if it's high-quality, and $500000 if it's low-quality, which seems to balance the risk and potential reward effectively.

You've taken advantage of the hedging option, and it seems to have worked out well for you. Given that you've bought 6 high-quality products and 3 low-quality products so far, I'll give you another signal. I'll tell you that the probability of a product being high-quality is still 80%, but I'll also mention that you've already bought 3 low-quality products, which is a significant deviation from the expected 20%. I'm offering you a 'last chance' to buy a high-quality product at a discounted price. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 20% discount, which would bring the price down to $800000. What do you think?
Considering the last chance and the discount offered, I will buy the product at $800000, hoping to continue the trend of high-quality purchases.

You've bought 7 high-quality products and 3 low-quality products so far. Given that you've just bought a high-quality product at the discounted price, I'll give you a 'final offer'. I'll tell you that I have only one product left, and I'm willing to give you a 30% discount on it, regardless of its quality. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate further. The price will be $700000. What do you think?
Given the final offer and the potential for a discount, I will buy the product at $700000, accepting the risk for the possibility of a high-quality product.

You've bought 8 high-quality products and 3 low-quality products so far. Given that you've just bought the last product at the discounted price, I'll let you know that the game is over. You've spent a total of $7800000 on 8 high-quality products and 3 low-quality products. I'll give you a final summary of the products you bought: 8 high-quality products at $1000000 each, and 3 low-quality products at $500000, $900000, and $800000. You can review the details and let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
The game is over, and I have reviewed the details of the products I bought. Thank you for the opportunity to participate in this unique game.
